entry.title: 20 Questions
entry.summary:
Author: carpediaz

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,847Chapters: 1/4Kudos: 7

Summary: “Alright,” Eddie hums. “You can ask me twenty questions.”“Only twenty questions?” Buck asks, exasperated. “Dude we have to ask each other questions all the time, I’m gonna run out like an hour into our next shift - wait, do I have to ask them all now?”“Twenty personal questions that I promise to answer honestly, as long as you answer the same question - or a contextually similar one - honestly as well. And I reserve the right to decline to answer any two questions until a later date,” Eddie corrects, adding a frankly obscene amount of sugar to his coffee. or The one where a game of 20 Questions shapes Buck and Eddie’s lives together.

Author: Graceful_Ashes

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,136Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 6

Summary: 𝑇ℎ𝑒𝑖𝑟 𝑙𝑖𝑣𝑒𝑠 𝑎𝑟𝑒 𝑖𝑛𝑡𝑒𝑟𝑡𝑤𝑖𝑛𝑒𝑑, 𝑖𝑛𝑒𝑥𝑡𝑟𝑖𝑐𝑎𝑏𝑙𝑦 𝑠𝑜. 𝐼𝑡'𝑠 𝑎 𝑡𝑟𝑢𝑡ℎ 𝐸𝑑𝑑𝑖𝑒 𝑘𝑛𝑜𝑤𝑠 𝑓𝑢𝑛𝑑𝑎𝑚𝑒𝑛𝑡𝑎𝑙𝑙𝑦. 𝐼𝑡'𝑠 𝑎 𝑔𝑟𝑜𝑢𝑛𝑑𝑖𝑛𝑔 𝑓𝑎𝑐𝑡 𝑎𝑏𝑜𝑢𝑡 ℎ𝑖𝑠 𝑎𝑛𝑑 𝐵𝑢𝑐𝑘’𝑠 𝑟𝑒𝑙𝑎𝑡𝑖𝑜𝑛𝑠ℎ𝑖𝑝. 𝑇ℎ𝑒𝑦'𝑟𝑒 𝑏𝑒𝑠𝑡 𝑓𝑟𝑖𝑒𝑛𝑑𝑠 𝑜𝑛 𝑡ℎ𝑒 𝑝𝑟𝑒𝑐𝑖𝑝𝑖𝑐𝑒 𝑜𝑓 𝑠𝑜𝑚𝑒𝑡ℎ𝑖𝑛𝑔 𝑚𝑜𝑟𝑒 𝑎𝑛𝑑 ℎ𝑒'𝑠 𝑖𝑛 𝑛𝑜 𝑟𝑢𝑠ℎ 𝑡𝑜 𝑝𝑢𝑠ℎ 𝑡ℎ𝑒𝑚 𝑖𝑛𝑡𝑜 𝑢𝑛𝑐ℎ𝑎𝑟𝑡𝑒𝑑 𝑤𝑎𝑡𝑒𝑟𝑠. 𝑇ℎ𝑒𝑦'𝑙𝑙 𝑓𝑖𝑛𝑑 𝑡ℎ𝑒𝑖𝑟 𝑤𝑎𝑦 𝑡ℎ𝑒𝑟𝑒 𝑒𝑣𝑒𝑛𝑡𝑢𝑎𝑙𝑙𝑦, 𝑖𝑡'𝑠 𝑖𝑛𝑒𝑣𝑖𝑡𝑎𝑏𝑙𝑒. 𝑆𝑜 𝐵𝑢𝑐𝑘 𝑐𝑎𝑛 𝑑𝑎𝑡𝑒 𝑜𝑡ℎ𝑒𝑟 𝑝𝑒𝑜𝑝𝑙𝑒 𝑓𝑜𝑟 𝑛𝑜𝑤, ℎ𝑒 𝑐𝑎𝑛 ℎ𝑎𝑣𝑒 ℎ𝑖𝑠 𝑓𝑢𝑛. 𝐸𝑑𝑑𝑖𝑒, 𝑤𝑜𝑛'𝑡 𝑠𝑝𝑜𝑖𝑙 𝑡ℎ𝑎𝑡 𝑓𝑜𝑟 ℎ𝑖𝑚. 𝐼𝑛 𝑡ℎ𝑒 𝑒𝑛𝑑, 𝐵𝑢𝑐𝑘 𝑎𝑙𝑤𝑎𝑦𝑠 𝑐𝑜𝑚𝑒𝑠 ℎ𝑜𝑚𝑒 𝑡𝑜 ℎ𝑖𝑚 – 𝑎𝑛𝑑 ℎ𝑒 𝑎𝑙𝑤𝑎𝑦𝑠 𝑤𝑖𝑙𝑙. entry.title: Fighting To Hold On
entry.summary:
Author: untoldchaos

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 52,218Chapters: 10/11Kudos: 160

Summary: Evan 'Buck' Buckley doesn't think of himself as a violent person. He forgets to remind himself of this fact as he draws his fist back and then hooks it around to strike his opponent. The returning blows come as a flurry of movement. First comes the impact, then a tingling sensation, and finally a throbbing pain radiating from Buck's jaw up to his temple and through his entire skull. He stumbles back; vision hazy, the faint metallic taste of blood in his mouth. Another hit lands before he has a chance to re-orientate himself, sending him falling backwards- hard.OrEddie has left for El Paso, so Buck needs a new hobby to keep distracted.Baking won't cut it. So, the obvious solution is beginner MMA.To make things interesting, Buck's trainer shares a striking resemblance to his best friend. Buck promises his loved ones that he won't go getting in to trouble, but he shouldn't make promises he can't keep...

entry.title: [PODFIC] The Mortifying Ordeal Of Being Known by Polish_Amber
entry.summary:
Author: RockStar03

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 204Chapters: 4/7Kudos: 29

Summary: The thing was, the 118 was full of gossips.Eddie had been at the station less than a week before Hen and Chim wrangled details about his “hot young thing” from him (“Buck is only 4 years younger than me, he is not a ‘hot young thing’!” Eddie complained.)And Bobby was open about his worries for his son’s lack of direction and the secrets he appears to be keeping (“I just wish I could help Evan find the thing that gives him purpose,” Bobby lamented.)It just made it all the more ridiculous (and horrifying) when Eddie realizes he’s been dating his Captain’s son this whole time (“Defiling his baby,” Chimney cackled, because he clearly wanted Eddie murdered.)--Or, the AU where miscommunication abounds as Eddie seeks advice about his new relationship, Bobby despairs over his adopted son's career prospects and his refusal to talk about it, and Evan Buckley-Nash juggles training at the fire academy, building a family with his new boyfriend, and trying to work out how to tell his overprotective dad that he's already chosen the life he wants, actually.It takes a goddamn tsunami, of all things, to get the story straight.

entry.title: Just Ask Josh
entry.summary:
Author: Madforyou

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 30,736Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 662

Summary: Chim is reading aloud before Buck can lunge across the counter and stop him, “I’d beg so loud they’d all know exactly what you—” His eyebrows climb to his hairline, “Buck, what the fuck?” Ravi bursts out laughing, nearly doubling over, “Wait, you sexted the group chat?!” “No, no, no—” Buck’s voice traitorously cracks and he can feel the heat in his face, “That’s not—I didn’t—” Hen’s tone sharpens, amusement undercut with curiosity, “You’re seeing someone? Who is she?” Or,Three months of secret hookups with Eddie and Buck manages to blow it all with one wrong text.

entry.title: What Died Didn't Stay Dead (Your Alive Your Alive)
entry.summary:
Author: Buddie_Butterflies

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 48,597Chapters: 11/12Kudos: 364

Summary: “I am looking for the Captain of this firehouse,” he heard the voice say.   He heard Tommy say, “Oh, you must be the person replacing me. Let me get Captain Nash for you.” He was friendly, but Bobby could hear a hint of mockery in that response. “You said Captain Nash?” the voice said, and without a doubt Bobby knew by the way he said his last name who was standing down in that bay and wasn’t going to be sticking around. He dropped the spoon he was stirring with, and it crashed to the ground as he bolted from around the counter towards the edge of the loft. “Buck,” he yelled, and the man with his back towards him kept walking. He started to take the stairs, and the figure kept walking, “Buck.” He could hear Hen and Chimeny following and saying, “Who is Buck?” but he didn’t have time to explain. He said the kid’s name several more times as he reached the bottom of the stairs. And when the figure was almost out of the firehouse doors, Bobby finally used his fatherly voice and yelled, “EVAN JAMES BUCKLEY YOU BETTER TURN YOUR ASS AROUND RIGHT NOW.” The figure stopped moving, but he did not turn around.   CHAPTER 11 PART 2 IS IN CHAPTER 11

entry.title: Buckley's Chance
entry.summary:
Author: RaspberryDreams1

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 43,032Chapters: 11/?Kudos: 414

Summary: Evan knows that wish babies are extremely rare, the Fae only grant a handful of wishes per year and almost never to single parents. But Evan so desperately wants a family to love that he’s been subconsciously wishing since he was a teenager. Eddie hadn’t thought of wishing for a baby, he had barely heard of wish babies or soulmates, his parents didn’t believe in such things. Eddie desperately wanted a place for him and his son to belong, a family that would accept him without demanding that he change who he was to fit their impossibly unrealistic expectations.
